The Hulabaloo staff took time
out early this week from its feverish distribution plans to elect the
Board of Control for next year's
publication.
The annual, which according to
editor-in-chief Pax Davis will
contain something new in the way
of yearbook presentations, - "I arrive on the Hopkins campus Friday ,rnorning. By the end of the
day the 800 books will be distributed to subscribers.
Experienced In Office
Forty-nine managing editor is
Bob Zadek and Warren Dederick,
brilliant cartoonist, will share the
editorship in next year's Levering
basement headquarters. The post
of business manager will be handled by Bill Beggs, a member of the
same staff during the past year.
Energetic freshman scribe Paul
Carson was elected managing editor while John Rittexhoff will retain his position of Photography
Editor to complete the list of controlling officers.
Spring Supplement
A spring supplement, containing
a coverage of June Week social
activities and a resume of spring
sports, will also be offered to year
book subscribers. Sched,'ed to be
off the presses by early August,
the supplement will contain eight
pages.
In the publication's business
department, subscribers who have
not completed final payment for
the book are being taken care of
by Efriam Potts.

Science Frat
Reorganized
The Alpha Eta Chapter of Phi
Lambda Upsilon, Honorary Chemical Society, is being .reactivated
at Hopkins after its lapse during
the war years.
Honorary members are men of
national reputation in the' field of
chemistry. This distinction has
been awarded to only nine men in
the past fourteen years.
Many Rise To Fame
The roll of honorary members
lists the names of prominent men
In american chemistry, including
America's three Nobel laureates
In chemistry.
The current pledge group consists of Robert Baumann, William
Hostnik, Joel Siegel, Alfred Viola,
Richard Betz, John Deuber, Eugene McCord, Louis Windsor,
Norris Chandler, Raymond Doyle,
Myron Belaga, Franke Leake,
Cherie Brunsman. They will be
initiated into full active membership on May 5.
Officers Listed
The present officers of the Hopkins Chapter of Chi Lambda Upsilon are: Morris Tannenbaum, president; Flavius Austin, vice-president; Al DeLeonardis, secretary;
Dan Schmidt, Alumni secretary;
Charles Megginis. treasurer.
Dr Harris of the department of
Chemical Engineering and Dr
Metcalfe of the department of
Chemistry are the faculty advisors.

Share Meal
Phyllis Lebowitz and Pax Davis
shared the meat in Front Page
with honor. The former brought a
heavy-lidded and sullen sensuality
to her role (and movement)• as
Molly Malloy; and this so convincingly that it was difficult, alas,
to envision her as the tragically
pure in heart. Pax Davis, milking
his expected and delayed entrance
forcefully, created the corruption
of Walter Burns beneath a shell
of appearance. Mrs. Schlosser, although only a character part, was
dramatically the most right person on stage.
Bill Clinger is a young man
clearly accomplished in stage business; but he nevertheless persisted
in playing Hildy Johnson with

umbrella painted green on the inside. Like a beach umbrella.

other hand for better protection.

Approximately 350 bewildered

last fall's run-around.

will be chosen next week out of

job. Last year's orientors will have
a preference; the rest of the lead-

ers will be chosen from the ranks
of the eager members of various
activities.
Since many varied activities are
trying to have themselves represented the varied propaganda
should provide a cheerfully confusing atmosphere to the already
confused novices.

The Hulabaloo staff took time

The annual, which according to
editor-in-chief Pax Davis will
contain something new in the way
of yearbook presentations, - "I arrive on the Hopkins campus Friday ,rnorning. By the end of the
day the 800 books will be distributed to subscribers.
Experienced In Office
Forty-nine managing editor is
Bob Zadek and Warren Dederick,
brilliant cartoonist, will share the
editorship in next year's Levering
basement headquarters. The post
of business manager will be handled by Bill Beggs, a member of the
same staff during the past year.
Energetic freshman scribe Paul
Carson was elected managing editor while John Rittexhoff will retain his position of Photography
Editor to complete the list of controlling officers.
Spring Supplement
A spring supplement, containing
a coverage of June Week social
activities and a resume of spring
sports, will also be offered to year
book subscribers. Sched,'ed to be
off the presses by early August,
the supplement will contain eight
pages.
In the publication's business
department, subscribers who have
not completed final payment for
the book are being taken care of
by Efriam Potts.

Science Frat
Reorganized
The Alpha Eta Chapter of Phi
Lambda Upsilon, Honorary Chemical Society, is being .reactivated
at Hopkins after its lapse during
the war years.
Honorary members are men of
national reputation in the' field of
chemistry. This distinction has
been awarded to only nine men in
the past fourteen years.
Many Rise To Fame
The roll of honorary members
lists the names of prominent men
In american chemistry, including
America's three Nobel laureates
In chemistry.

Hostnik, Joel Siegel, Alfred Viola,
Richard Betz, John Deuber, Eugene McCord, Louis Windsor,
Norris Chandler, Raymond Doyle,
Myron Belaga, Franke Leake,
Cherie Brunsman. They will be
initiated into full active membership on May 5.
Officers Listed
The present officers of the Hopkins Chapter of Chi Lambda Upsilon are: Morris Tannenbaum, president; Flavius Austin, vice-president; Al DeLeonardis, secretary;
Dan Schmidt, Alumni secretary;
Charles Megginis. treasurer.
Dr Harris of the department of
Chemical Engineering and Dr
Metcalfe of the department of
Chemistry are the faculty advisors.

Three Hundred Freshmen
Infest Campus In Fall
Approximately 350 bewildered
frosh will infest the campus next
fall for the ten day orientation
program from September 19 to 28.
The flock will be separated into
ten groups shephered by two student leaders and a faculty member. Activities of the program consist of playing follow the leader
through a course very similar to
last fall's run-around.
31 Guideposts
-Thirty-one stalwart guideposts
will be chosen next week out of
the fifty-six who applied for the
job. Last year's orientors will have
a preference; the rest of the lead-

ers will be chosen from the ranks
of the eager members of various
activities.
Since many varied activities are
trying to have themselves represented the varied propaganda
should provide a cheerfully confusing atmosphere to the already
confused novices.

of things not previously taken
care of.

will have charge of the physical
education portion of the program
while Carey will guide the less
muscular activity aspirants.
Champ Sheridan will assist Gibson in the dirty work. The committee is completed by director of
admissions William Logan and his
second Bob Blunno.
